Class ScaledError<N extends Number>

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss.ScaledError<N>
All Implemented Interfaces:
NumberTypeAgnostic<N>, BatchLossFunction<N>, DimensionLossFunction<N>, LossFunction<N>, SampleLossFunction<N>
@Decorator @Strategy(CONCRETE) public class ScaledError<N extends Number> extends Object implements DimensionLossFunction<N>, SampleLossFunction<N>, BatchLossFunction<N>
A decorator loss function that applies a fixed scaling factor to the results of another loss function.

ScaledError can operate at multiple levels of loss calculation — dimension, sample, and batch — by delegating to an underlying LossFunction and scaling its results by a constant multiplier.

For example, when wrapping a SquaredError with a scaling factor of 0.5, this class produces the commonly used Mean Squared Error (MSE) formulation: 

 MSE = 0.5 * (predicted - target)^2

      Parameters:

    • calculateGradient_dJ_dL

      public N calculateGradient_dJ_dL(int batchSize)
      Computes the gradient of the batch loss with respect to the per-sample losses. This is commonly denoted as dJ/dL in backpropagation equations.
      Specified by:
      calculateGradient_dJ_dL in interface BatchLossFunction<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      batchSize - the number of samples in the batch
      Returns:
      the gradient of the batch loss with respect to each sample loss

    • calculateGradient_dl_da

      public N calculateGradient_dl_da(N estimated, N target)
      Calculates the gradient of the dimension loss with respect to the activation (output) of this dimension. This corresponds to dl/da in backpropagation formulas.
      Specified by:
      calculateGradient_dl_da in interface DimensionLossFunction<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      estimated - the predicted or estimated value for this dimension
      target - the expected or target value for this dimension
      Returns:
      the gradient of the loss with respect to the activation

    • calculateSampleLoss

      public N calculateSampleLoss(List<N> dimensionLosses)

      Parameters:
      dimensionLosses - a list of losses for each output dimension
      Returns:
      the total sample loss

    • calculateGradient_dL_dl

      public N calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions)

      Specified by:
